questions: Which type of cell division helps in regeneration?
answers: Mitosis, because it keeps all the somatic cells of an organism genetically similar, so that they are able to regenerate a part or whole of the organism.

answers: The two chemicals that arrest the cell division in a cell are (i) Colchicine (ii) Cyanides.

questions: What is a kinetochore ?
answers: Kinetochore is a part of a chromosome for the attachment of chromosomal fibres.

questions: How do cell stop dividing?
answers: When cell enters in G 0 cycle.

questions: Name the forces which help in chromosomal movement during cell division.
answers: Contraction of chromosome fibres, formation and expansion of interzonal fibres and poleward dissolution of microtubules of chromosome fibres..

questions: What are kinetochores ?
answers: Small disc-shaped structures at the surface of the centromeres which serve as the sites of attachment of spindle fibres are called as kinetochores.

questions: When does syncytium condition takes place?
answers: When nuclear division takes place without cytoplasmic division it results in the formation of large number of nuclei in a cell. This condition is called syncytium.

questions: Name the enzymes which help in breakage and reunion of chromatids.
answers: Enzyme that help in breakage is endonuclease and enzyme that help in reunion is Rprotein.

questions: What is a metaphase plate?
answers: It is an imaginary plane perpendicular to the spindle fibers of a dividing cell, along which chromosomes align during metaphase.

questions: What is nucleocytoplasmic ratio ?
answers: It is a ratio of the size (i.e. volume) of the nucleus of a cell to the size to the cytoplasm of that cell.

questions: What is the average cell cycle span for a mammalian cell ?
answers: 24 hours is average duration.

questions: Name the longest and shortest phase of mitosis ?
answers: Prophase has longest duration, while anaphase has the shortest duration.

questions: By which method cytokinesis occurs in an animal cell ?
answers: By furrowing.

questions: What do you understand by synaptonemal complex?

questions: What Is generation time ?
answers: The time interval between two cell cycles is called generation time.

questions: Why is meiosis known as "Reduction Division'? What is its significance?
answers: Meiosis is called as reduction division because the chromosome number gets reduced to its half. It helps in producing haploid gametes in sexually reproducing organisms.

questions: Name the phase of meiosis I which is characterized by the appearance of recombination nodules?
answers: Pachytene.

questions: Name the cells where mitosis and meiosis occur.
answers: Mitosis occurs in somatic cell whereas meiosis occurs in diploid.

questions: Why is meiosis called the reductional division whereas mitotic division is called as equational division?
answers: Meiosis is called as reductional division because the chromosome number gets reduced to its half whereas mitosis is equational division because the chromosome number remains the same after division.

questions: What are interzonal fibres ?
answers: The protein fibres are formed in between the centromeres of homologous chromosomes during metaphase I stage of meiosis are called interzonal fibres.

questions: Define crossing over.
answers: Crossing over is the exchange of genetic material between the non-sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes during pachytene of prophase.

questions: What are dyads?
